title: Drawing, "Design for Clock", 1800–25
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and yellow, red watercolor, graphite, on cream laid paper
inscribed: Below, in pen and brown ink: g d l / un figure et un amour avec vase c a e / a a c
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Base of clock supported by lion feet, decorated at front with octagonal panel with a bow and quiver crossed, horizontally places lyres flank panel. Two-handled vase on top of dial. At left, cupid brings a rose and chain to woman a woman in classical garb, at right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Clock", 1800–25.
1800–25. Pen and black ink, brush and yellow, red watercolor, graphite, on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-71-4.
